definition[0]: when no one wants to do anything to change a situation
definition[1]: the force that keeps an object in the same position or keeps it moving until it is moved or stopped by another force
definition[2]: a lack of energy and a feeling that you do not want to do anything
definition[3]: a tendency for a situation to stay the same for a long time
example[1]: He believes that suppressed demand after years of inertia will lead to a housing recovery this year.
